result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon N. Kositzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

VRCW. 
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF121:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information Filed; Reading Waived. 
Parties are to proceed to the Plea Hearing- 

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CF121:
Delete 'Repeater' Enhancer on Count 1.

22CM51:
Ct. 1 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CF121:
Ct. 1 (Sex Registry Violation)>> NO CONTEST. 
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Defendant makes statements.

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF121:
Ct. 1 (Sex Registry Violation)>> 20 Days MCJ. Court finds 20 Days Credit. Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office. 

Adjourned: 11:17 am
